intro: Pfaffia tuberculosa, commonly known as curcuma, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its rhizomatous root system and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive tuberculate pattern on the bracts.
